Reviews.Title: “High price, average hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel16
Reviews.Content: We travel with 2 kids and they try to give us other room: twin room (19 m2) instead family room (35 m2), for the reason that the kids are small !!!! The bathroom smells awful so we must cover the leakage all the time. The pool is very small, but clean and the water is 20-21 degrees. In front of hotel is a football field and the people training there up to 2 am, but if you close the window, it is ok.The hotel is very near from Sultanameth, about 10 min. walk. The restaurant has a poor option for food, but the personal is nice and they have 3 times a week some Turkish musicians playing very nice. The terrace on the top has a great view. Don't accept for the people from hotel to book you the restaurant (they will insist) because you will get the most expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: majid02
Reviews.Content: A very enjoyable few days in Istanbul and all helped by the excellent staff in this hotel. From the bell boys to the manager and receptionist, they would do anything to help and seemed so genuinely friendly and hospitable. We got in and didn't have change for the taxi (large notes only on us) and the night concierge paid for the cab out of his own pocket! Paid him back of course, but almost as if he would't take it. Professional and efficient - great. The hotel is clean and new and good value. It is off the main streets so you should get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “too small, very good bedding”
Reviews.Author: Jutta C
Reviews.Content: my double room was small but the bathroom is worse you have to squeeze you in,25 cm between the opened door and the washbowl! renovated, yes, but they do not take care, seals in the shower cubicles (in the 2 rooms I booked) are already black and leaking, the bathroom is flooded after showering.In some months from now it will be a real mess in the ceilings and walls. Breakfast OK, friendly staff, good location.Rooms, street view, are noisy,soccer field in front of the hotel, games going on to 1 am. 3 bed room was big and nice, but only a very little closet, we have to let our clothes in the suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff Make this a Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlustfamilyof4
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Best Western Antea Palace was by necessity; our flight out of Istanbul was cancelled after many delays. We found Antea Palace on Trip Advisor while still waiting in the air terminal. We didn't arrive until after 10:30 p.m.; however, the nightshift staff were incredibly helpful, specially RESAT. He had a room for our family of four quickly made up, called back the chef who was leaving for the night and had him prepare us an amazing meal of grilled chicken and rice, as well as insured we were up and ready early the next a.m. for our rescheduled flight. Even though breakfast service didn't normally begin until 7 a.m., he and his staff had everything ready by 6 a.m. so we could have a bite to eat before leaving. Even though we weren't planning on one more night in Turkey, Resat and the staff at the Best Western made us comfortable and content. The room decor was a bit over-the-top; however, the hotel was exceptionally clean and centrally located. I can honestly recommend this hotel based on the staff alone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 4 nights”
Reviews.Author: Minals
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent position with all attractions easily accessible from here. The staff were so helpful, and never shyed away from anything we asked of them. The rooms, we're clean, and of an ok size - kind of what you would expect from a city hotel. The shower was tiny though. Breakfast was ok, cereals, a selectin of cold, breads and 1 type of egg each day. But enough to get your day started. Arzoo was very helpful, and really tried her best to help you in any way she could, from planning your day for you to organising a days excursion or hamam. Lovely experience and would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mirantparikh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights, The hotel was beautfiul and clean. Arzu at the front desk, as well as the Rashid, Guven AKtas,Erland, Barish and other kitchen / porter staff were very friendly and helpful. It is very conveniently located with easy access to the main attractions. We only used public transport once during our 5 days stay. We would love to visit this hotel again and would highly recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl247
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 10 day s...I can't say enough about the staff.Rashid at the front desk was extremelypatient, friendly, helpful and resourceful! In addition the breakfast staff specifically Erland provided excellent service! The hotel is beautiful and clean.The rooftop view was simply amazing! I would definately stay at this hotel next time I visit Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edith e
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the hotel. It is situated near almost all the important sights of Istanbul. So you don't need any public transport. The rooms are nice and the staff is really very friendly. The breakfast is ok. It's very quiet althought it's near the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: DrKnowHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated in Sultanahmet old town it is an easy walk to the major attractions Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque plus the tram line to everywhere else. It is a slightly farther walk to the Tokapi Palace . Inside the hotel is refurbished in what I would describe as a very pleasent Rococo style. Staff excellent. Welcome little pool and sauna. Nice breakfast, nice bar. Write the full address down for any taxi drivers as there are lot of Best Westerns. It was approx 40 YTL from the airport which you can get from numerous ATMs.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ambermash
Reviews.Content: Beatifully welcoming! A really nice place to stay, reception was great! Guven (front of house) made our stay fantastic, we hadn't arranged any tours before our departure but he helped organise our entire 5 day stay in minutes, he also went out of his way to make sure the taxis were giving us a fair deal! Arzu (also front pf house) was very helpful about guiding us to the local restaurants. Despite the fact the staff had a really busy week they always made us feel we could approach them. Amongst other things, the evening live turkish band was. a nice touch. Food was flavoursome and fresh! Waiters were also really accomodating, the main waiter Abdurrahman was extremely so. A highly recommended place to stay! Loved ISTANBUL!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: Maashaal
Reviews.Content: Easy access to alot of the site seeing! Lovely staff throughout and really FRESH nice food! A really lovely hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Cheated”
Reviews.Author: hulyam
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a three night stay as it seemed very good value for money, within distance of the historical sites and included a one way free airport transfer and Spa.It turned out the free transfer was for five nights or more not three as advertised.The hotel blamed the booking website. The Spa/Pool was a little disappointing and quite small.With only a couple of pieces of gym equipment. I'd also booked a twin room and upon arrival I was told there was an extra bed in our room.No problem I thought, turned out that it was a double bed/room with two Z beds.They'd said they may be able to move us after the first night but never got back to us. Decor a little dated with lots of crushed velvet and velour. On the plus side the breakfast was very good offering a good selection of hot and cold dishes.

Reviews.Title: “If you choose hotel based on pool and fitness photos - you are cheated!!!”
Reviews.Author: Filmofil
Reviews.Content: Photos of pool and fitness are not from real life. Size of pool is like bath tub. Location is just OK because for the same price you can get better location! Fitness has two tredmill and that's about it. Only what is fine is service as everywhere in Istanbul! I choose this hotel based on reviews and still wandering do we talk about same hotel!!! I would not recomend it nor go back to this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “my stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 1637597June22
Reviews.Content: i have just come back from my stay at this hotel spent seven days the hotel was fantastic spotlessly clean breakfast had everything you could want service was really good Adam and Apo were excellant but all the staff where friendly and polite i would highly recomened this hotel ISTANBUL is a buetiful place and well worth a trip cant wait to go back i am a regular traveler to Turkey,and i think the country is a wonderfull place to visit. June from Engand

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed very much”
Reviews.Author: stas k
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed very marmly, offered Turkish coffea and gaves many useful informations about the city, very proffesional and helpful staff. Antea Palace is located very well, histortical side of the City , walking distanse to all historical monuments and also veru short walk to the Sea. Breakfast was wonderful with so many variety. Also enjoyed Turkish bath , swimming pool for free of charge . Thank you all, we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: robert970
Reviews.Content: Stayed at december 2011, thank you all staf made our holiday veru enjoyable and we felt safe at hotel. We used promotion , they arranged our airport transfer , dinner , lovely SPA and also surprize gifts at chek-out. We will definitely recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Happy Holidays, at wonderful Antea Palace!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaclyn N
Reviews.Content: Our Christmas and New Years stay at Hotel Antea Palace was nothing short of a fantastic experience. From the wonderful service to the home-felt comfort, we would very highly recommend anyone travelling to Istanbul to stay at Hotel Antea!! The most impressive things at Hotel Antea were the cleanliness of the rooms and entire hotel, historically rich decor, professional and friendly staff, amazing location and spa facilities. Hotel Antea's personal Hammam was beautiful and right in the hotel. We were able to enjoy the Turkish spa experience in a truly relaxing style, not having to leave our warm hotel. The waitstaff was very professional and spoke great English, which as a foreigner, felt very comforting. The food was delicious and economically reasonable. The breakfast buffet of cheeses and breads, olives and eggs and more made us fully energized for a full day of sightseeing. Not sure what to do in Istanbul? We weren't exactly sure on everything either, but the staff helped us choose the best events to attend and places to see! Make sure you check out a cruise along the Bosporus River and a cultural Sufi performance. Thanks to the Hotel Antea, and lovely weather, we were able to walk to all the main sightseeing attractions! Keep up the great work Hotel Antea, and we can't wait to come visit you again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: AP_Russia
Reviews.Content: LOCATION. The hotel is conveniently located close to main sites of Istanbul - Sultanahmet mosque, Hagia Sophia and also Cisterna Basilica. From the other hand location on a of of small streets makes some problems. It's very easy to get lost just walking around the hotel. Also most of taxi drivers don't know this hotel and stop to ask locals where it is. As to public transportation, I can't evaluate the hotel's location because I was in Istanbul for business and used a rented car with a driver. STAFF. The staff is quite friendly. There were no problems with any of the guys. ROOMS. I stayed in the hotel twice during 1 trip and lived in two different rooms. I liked both. Floors are covered with a carpeting, Furniture, air conditioning, TV... Everything is absolutely OK. Wi-fi connection is available. There is a full set of toiletry in the bathroom. Bathrobe and slippers are also available in every room. BREAKFAST. Breakfast is good. Fresh local fruits (wide choice!), corn flakes, sausages, cheese, etc. Probably local tea is not very delicious but it's not a problem. SPA. I had no time to explore it, sorry. GENERAL IMPRESSION. I did really like staying in the hotel. Everything was comfortable, satisfying and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a princess”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteUKcambridge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the historical heart of Istanbul and allowed me an easy and fast access to many wonderful places. It also offers everything you need for a very comfortable stay. Furthermore the very beautiful and luxury location makes you feel special. I really can suggest this hotel and its service. Many thanks to everyone there, you made my trip unique and I really appreciate your kindness. It was the best choice I could make.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Martino F
Reviews.Content: Imagine yourself in a city you've never been to? That was what happened to us in Istanbul -- found hotel via Trip Advisor and so happy followed people's advices to pick this particular hotel! Even when it was a gloomy weather staying in the hotel was always pleasant and relaxing. We really liked their rich breakfasts and comparatively moderate prices for delicious dinners! Their Marble Hammam and sauna was a cool continuation of our evenings before we would go on night to Sultanahmet and Taksim! The hotel staff was so kind and friendly and assisted us in getting a night Bosphorus tour on boat and Turkish dancing show at Hadjipasha. Thank you Trip Advisers for suggesting this! We loved Istanbul and Antea Hotel Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Nada E
Reviews.Content: Excellent staffâ€� Extremely enjoyable trip, very helpful and friendly staff in particular Ms Ercan Arzu and Guven at reception, will certainly recommend it to a friend. The location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best services and friendly”
Reviews.Author: popov s
Reviews.Content: The Antea Palace hotel is an excellent choise as base for exploring the historical sights of Istanbul. Location can not be any better, next door to Aya Sofia and coyple of minutew walk to the blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. Excellent staff, veru friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exsellent location, nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: bikina a
Reviews.Content: Location the hotel is great. Staff veru friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel - cosy and well worth a visit!”
Reviews.Author: paulnpaula
Reviews.Content: I see that the majority of reviewers have put this hotel as 3 - 5. This is fair but I would rate it higher and to be hinest I think 5 if fair. It was our first trip to Istanbul and we had little idea seiously what to expect. The hotel is at the edge of the Sultanhamet area - close to the railway and the main road BUT taxi drivers do have problems finding it (ours got there in the end bless him - after long chats on his mobile) BUT when you are there everyting is on your doorstep including the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace but you are also ten minutes from the grand bazar and twenty minutes from the Spice Bazar and the Golden Horn! In other words ideal to explore on foot. Food was excellent - not highly priced (on a par with Good restaurants) breakfast was plentiful and contrary to other reviews, food never ran out and if it did they replenished it (even close to end of service). If there is one niggle, the spa can be booked for guests private use - this means that the rest of plebs don't get a look in - and at â‚¬20 this is pricey PLUS don't know many hotels that would do this to the detriment to the remainder of their guests. In addition if you are a serious swimmer beware its a small hotel and the pool you get is tiny - seven strokes and its done! Heartily recommended and as we told the Manager today - we will return.... but next time without credit cards so my wife will not be tempted to buy another blooming carpet!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Nice location, Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Sidhaks
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was excellent. Staff were very helpful, especially Ms Ercan at reception who was fantastic. The city attractions are within a few minutes walking distance of hotel, don't waste money on a tour guide. Would recommend using the tram to visit the beautiful Dolambache castle ( Kabatas stop ) and then experience the nightlife at Taksim (a short metro journey from Kabatas). The Akbil card ( similar to oyster card ) is useful on the public transport and is available outside most metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “"The unforgetable holidays in Istanbul"”
Reviews.Author: Emir R
Reviews.Content: Hallo to everybody, i was one month ago in Istanbul and have chosen Best Western Antea Palace Hotel. I enojeyed my stay there, it was really comfortable, clean, beautiful, nice and luxurious. The food was very delicious. Moreover i used the fitness-center of the hotel and like it very much. The personal of the hotel was very friendly, kind and polite, they were also very intilligent and responded all my questions about the history of Turkey and some seesights. So, i advise everybody who wants to have an unforgettable time in Turkey, to chose this hotel! You will be satisfied for sure! Best regards, Emir

Reviews.Title: “High standard.High service 24 hours.”
Reviews.Author: sommermari
Reviews.Content: It`s second time I visit this beautyful serviceminded Hotel. It will be my favoritplace in Istanbul in the future.. And I travel a lot for both buisness and pleasure. And the hotel is in walking distance to evrything woth seeing. The interiur is magnificent and the cleaning is superb..The indoor swimmingpoolarea is a beautyfull place to relax after a busy day. The staff help you in everyway day and night. Just ask the english wellspeaking staff in reception. No matter what time of day, the service is very proffesional and their knowledge about Istanbul, for example historical sights and booking different things is great. The atmosphere is very luxury but in same way very gentle. And the breakfast is splendid no matter what country you come from, you will find it delicius. I can only give the best recommondation for this hotel wich, not to forget , have the best terrace on the roof with wiew over Marmara Sea. You can ask for everything and the staff will stand on their head to make you pleasure. You will see me soon again. I send yu my best regards.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Carlo B
Reviews.Content: I spent a Weekend there with my family. The hotel is actually good located, nothing to say about that, but not so easy to find for all the taxi drivers we took during the weekend. Don't forget to take a hotel card with a map on it to show to the taxi driver ! I actually hate hotels with carpets, but probably 90 % of the Hotels in Istanbul have them. My room was big and clean, but soooo smelly that I had to spleep with wide open windows during the entire weekend even if outside it was probably 5 degrees. I tell you, never had such a smelling room in my life. My sisters had another room, the heating was not working and they changed room in the middle of the night because they were frising. Breakfast was horrible. The coffee, the orange juice... you could not drink them. I would not suggest to stay there. I did not go to the HAMMAN since my sisters told me it was smelly aswell !

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Antea Palace Hotel, but not with the best Spa service”
Reviews.Author: linda s
Reviews.Content: During our city break (4-6th November 2011) in Istanbul with my hubby we have stayed at Best Western Antea Palace Hotel. We were very happy with this pick, the hotel is fabulous, and the room was very spacious, as well as bathroom was very large and lovely. The hotel in overall was kept in very good conditions, clean and tidy, to the highest standards. We were also very satisfied with the customer service and all staff, who were very friendly and polite, providing fantastic service. Especially nice surprise for us was to get upgraded upon arrival (completely free of charge!) to a suite-room, needless to say how glad and stunned we were. Despite excellent room condition and staff service, we were a bit disappointed with breakfast and food selection. There was average choice of eggs, cheese, cereals, the sausages were rather bad. It was very disappointing that they did not serve any of the traditional Turkish food, but only very average breakfast meal. Another downside of the hotel was its location. The hotel is located next to the rail station and football pitch. The walking distance to the famous Sultan Ahmed area is about 10-15 minutes. However, the greatest disadvantage was Hamam and Spa service that were closing at 6.00pm. This was really inconvenient as we were planning to spend our day out in the town and sightseeing, and in the evening we would prefer to go to sauna and spa and relax after long tiring day. Moreover, they did not provide Hamam service, which was very upsetting as one of our main priorities when choosing a hotel was availability of Hamam and sauna. Overall, the impression from our stay in this place was quite satisfying. Apart from disappointment in Hamam and Spa rooms, and food selection, we did enjoy our holiday break and would recommend using Best Western Antea Palace Hotel service to other visitors in future, but probably we would not come back there again.

Reviews.Title: “"A comfortable Hotel und a friendly Personal"”
Reviews.Author: Tugba U
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend have visited the hotel in October and we must say that it is one of the best hotels which we have ever been in. The atmosphere at the hotel is very sadative, the colours of the rooms and the hotel generally are rich and chic, the rooms are clean, the food is delicious, the personal is very kind and helpful, the prices are good. So we stayed happy with this hotel and advise it to everybody who wants to visit Istanbul. Have a nice time! Best regards, Tugba and Martin

Reviews.Title: “Nearby the Sightseeings”
Reviews.Author: Harald_Kiedrich
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the surround of the Old City of Istanbul. All the import sightseeings, such as Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace can be reached within a 5 up to 10 minutes footwalk. The rooms are clean and in a typical turkish style. The personal is friendly and gives all the assistance necessary for a good stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Problem place”
Reviews.Author: Lenny R
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in the middle of October, and the weather in Istanbul was very upleasant - rainy, cold, windy. Our room was cold too. When we asked to increase the temperature, we were told that the "heating season did not start yet". We were freezing for 3 of 4 days, until finally the heat came up on the last night we were there. Internet connection was working in one part of our suite but not the other. Jacuzzi was the pinnacle of the experience. When I tried to warm myself up in it and turned on the pump, brown slimy gunk came out of it. This was one of the most disgusting experiences I have ever had. This gunk covered the whole tup and proved to be so sticky that it refused to come off even after the water was drained. The consierge sent a person who did not speak English and who though that we needed help to learn how to operate the pump and diligently gestured to us toward the appropriate buttons. After we complained to the consierge, he sent him again and subsequently assured us that the "everything was cleaned". Well, it was not. We had no choice but to use this disgustingly-looking filthy tub until the next day when cleaning people finally took care of it.

Reviews.Title: “If the taxis find it!”
Reviews.Author: Jekoko
Reviews.Content: The rooms look a little funny. Full of red and gold features, but that might be due to the local style. DonÂ´t get me wrong though, they are nice and clean. The breakfast was really good but crowded. One problem is the location. It will take you/the taxi driver a while to find it. Instanbul streets are not easy to find and this one is a real challenge!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position, high standard”
Reviews.Author: Patricia194436
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a perfect position to view all the main sights in Sultanahmet, the old part of Istanbul and was also in a quiet neighbourhood. The decor was plush and everything comfortable and clean. Breakfast was good - I just wish they had included English teabags! The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas C
Reviews.Content: We had a twin room which was tiny 12ft x 10ft dark and dreary. There was no drawer space at all, and only half a small wardrobe, the other half taken up by the safe and the mini-bar, as there was not enough space in the bed room for the mini-bar. So we had to live out of the suit cases, but there was only one case stand, so the other case had to go on the only bed side table, and the phone had to go on the floor.There was no tea & coffee in the room, and when we complained, they brought a kettle, but the was no plug sockets in the room. They then provided an extension lead for the kettle, but the only place it could go was from the razor socket in the bathroom, and sit on the floor. This was not safe as the shower base leaked and flooded the bath room. There were no shelves in the bath room so all your personal bits and pieces had to be carried in and out. The heated towel rail didn't work, the TV wouldn't change station, the radiator was locked off, the toilet cistern ran constantly and when the air conditioning packed up, rather than repair it, they switched it of permanently at the contact breaker board. The only response we got from the staff was, " it is the only room available." We have traveled to many cities in the last 40 years, and if it wasn't that the beds were very comfortable, this would have been the worst room we had ever stayed in. We have used Best Western for 20 years, and this is the first time that we have left a B.W. believing that we had been ripped off. Reading other peoples' reviews, it's difficult to believe we were stopping in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Wounderful place to relax"”
Reviews.Author: Olga P
Reviews.Content: Hi to everybody! The hotel impressd us absolutely. The rooms were clean, the personal was very kindly and the design of the hotel gave usa feeling as if we would be in a beautiful castle. Moreover the hotel is located 7 min. form the city centre. So, one can go by foot to see the seesights of Istanbul. Enjoy your stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - great staff”
Reviews.Author: stamford C
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel - very friendly and helpful staff and so close to all the main sites of the city. Took a bit of finding even by a local Taxi driver who gave us a mini tour of the old town before we got there - not intended. A great brief stay - didn't try the Restaurant for Dinner but the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Valensander
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago I ended up at the BW Antea Palace in Istanbul, after some terrible experiences with other hotels. I have been working in customer service for almost 20 years and have had numerous courses and seminars on how to treat customers. Well, the Antea should be in the "how to" film. I just had lasik eye surgery (very recommended in Istanbul!) and they were so kind to me. They offered me a free meal, but especially the kind and geniuine attention made it so special. I must thank mr. Mustafa and mrs. Arlu at the front desk. They were amazing! Also mr. Ercan Ulu, the manager, was so kind and helpful. Just before being picked up (after checkout) I waited near the front desk in the lobby and I noticed they were so kind and efficient to ALL customers. I've traveled a lot and I've stayed in many, many hotels, but this one will always be on my mind. Beside the customer service, it's a centrally located hotel, very close to the big tourist attractions. Very clean and unique decor. My free meal in the hotel-restaurant was a fixed menu, but really tasteful and fresh! Once again, THANK YOU BW Antea Palace for making my stay so good!

Reviews.Title: “A Clean Hotel - although not the best location”
Reviews.Author: CompassRoseK
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Istanbul we were a bit rushed and booked a weekend here at the last minute. Having looked at TripAdvisor and others we thought it was a fair bet. Trying to get to the hotel was Impossible. Every. Time. During our stay we must have taken at least 6 taxi rides back to the hotel. Not one driver could find it. Even with the Hotel business card and a printout map. Eventually we just got out and walked the remaining 10 minutes to the hotel. The Antea Palace is definitely on the fringe of the "Historic Old Town" quarter with the immediate surroundings blending into railway lines, football pitches and run down suburban apartments. I will say that all the staff at the hotel were very warm and helpful and helped us to arrange meals, taxis and tours. Our room was new, the bathroom was clean and had all the standard amenities. The free bottled water in the room was a nice touch, as was the courteous late-check out. The public spaces were dimly lit and a little creepy; better lighting and some music would have cheered it up a bit. We found breakfast to be unappetizing and a bit strange - again the dim lighting didn't help. I will concede that our Anglo taste buds were far out of their comfort zone on most of our trip to Istanbul and so we just took it in our stride. Overall a satisfactory stay - but there are dozens of hotels that offer similar service and facilities in far more convenient locations with a warmer atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Wounderful place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Elena S
Reviews.Content: I liked the BEST WESTERN ANTEA PALACE HOTEL very much, because it was pretty comfortable, clean and nice there. Especially i enjoyed the delicious breakfast, which contains different arts of bread, fruits, corn flakes, vegetables, sweats and etc. Sometimes i was using the fitnesscenter of the hotel in order to stay fit, it was quite good. The staff of the hotel was very helpful, friendly and kind. Moreover the Hotel is located 10 min. from the citycenter and from the beautiful seesights of Istanbul. Generally i am glad that i have been to Istanbul and have stayed at this hotel. Therefore i recommend highly o everybody , who wants to enjoy their time in Turkey to chose this hotel! You will be satisfied for sure. Best regards, Elena

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah s
Reviews.Content: Hello We stayed in this hotel one week with our 2 girls. This hotel is very family friendly. Our girls loved the swimming pool and The location of the hotel is perfect, you can walk to the resturants, caffes, bazar, and the very nice and friendly staff are always there to help you with anything. The breakfast is just perfect so fresh and nice made. The rooms are nice and clean and the beds are so comfortable, the dinner and lunch at hotels resturant is nice and tastes very nice. Also the Hotel feels safe for a family with small children. Next time we go to Istanbul we would love to come back to this lovely hotel . Greetings from Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and their service”
Reviews.Author: ocean_breeze65
Reviews.Content: We are so happy we decided to stay in this hotel. It's been recently renovated so everything was clean, new and working perfectly. The decoration and furnishings of the hotel are gorgeous. You get the feeling you are in the sultan's palace. The reception staff was great and always ready to help you in every way. We actually got 2 rooms instead of 1 family room free of charge. The breakfast was really good and sumptuous. We used their restaurant for dinner a few times. The food was really good. They also have great facilities and the roof terrace with excellent view. The hotel is very close to the old city centre. It's only 10 minutes walk. I would greatly recommend the Antea palace for everyone. You'll enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfektes Hotel zum Urlaub”
Reviews.Author: Maria S
Reviews.Content: Hi to everybody, in the beginning of august i decided to go to Istanbul in order to have a rest. I chose Best Western Antea Hotel, because i looked before at its homepage and found it suitable. I must say that i was not mistaken about my choice: the hotel is not far away from the important sightseeing places of Istanbul and has everything what a good hotel needs, like a kind personal, clean, comfortable rooms, delicious food, swimming-pool, fitnesscenter and etc. I felt myself at the hotel like a princess in a palace, because it was really luxurious and beautiful. In the evening i used to go to the terass-restaurant which is located at the 4 th floor and used to eat some sweats or fruits. Concerning the service of the hotel, they were very friendly and ready to help in choosing the food or visiting the interesting sightseeings places. So, i was really positively surprised. So i would like to recommend this hotel to everybody who wants to enjoy their stay in Istanbul. Have a nice time! Best regards, Maria

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holidays”
Reviews.Author: 918Giulio71
Reviews.Content: Strategic location, only few minutes walking from main interesting monuments (Aya Sophia; Topkapi, Blue Mosk and cystern Basilic). Suite was well equipped and space was enough for all the family. Finally personnel was very kind (a special mention for Mustafa) and always willing to help with trip organization and various requests

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReÅŸat S
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel first week of augost and hotel was very clean and center of old city also all staff was helpfull for us..Hope next year i will stay this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made me enjoy Istanbul by forgetting that I'm on a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I chose this hotel for my business trip that was supposed to be as close to my counterparts in Istanbul as possible. The price was fine, the location was just perfect to have meetings with my Turkish fellas just across-the-street. After we had a bunch of meetings my evening walk made me realize that I can't just ignore this opportunity to enjoy sites offered by the hotel -- the view on Marmara Sea, quiet neighborhood and ancient Sofiya Mosque became highlights of my trip, apart from business of course. With my business projects, I'm planning to visit Istanbul very often in the nearest future. They say the Fall is beautiful and warm and nice in here. For that, I'll be bringning my family later this year for sure. Thanks to the managers and staff of the hotel -- felt like home. Tesekkur :)

Reviews.Title: “Average so far, seems to be improved soon”
Reviews.Author: stanMoscow
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, but small. Taxi drivers have to ask locals a couple of times to find the hotel. Breakfast is modest. The hotel is very new and the owner cares about it and has plans to improve. Staff is polite and eager to help. When you sit on a terrace you can enjoy the sea view 4-5 blocks ahead ( and there's a railroad btwn you and the sea, however it is to be said that this railroad isn't something that you'll hear at night)

Reviews.Title: “Our best impressions”
Reviews.Author: Andrei-Kiev
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife visited this hotel in April 2011 and we stayed very glad about this hotel. It is situated in very quiet and comfortable place in 10 minutes from Blue Mask and St. Sofia. We had a room with a sea view. Hotel is decorated in classic style and we were satisfied with classic music which was playing there all the time. It was very pleasant to relax in swimming pool, sauna, hamam and to have nice relaxing massage after daily walks and excursions. For breakfast we had a lot of different and tasty meals. We'd like to notice polite and welcomed personnel. Also we'd like to thank manager of hotel. In August we plan to visit this hotel again with our friends. We advise to everybody to do the same. Andrei, Victoria from Kiev (Ukraine).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, Turkish opulence, recommend for families”
Reviews.Author: Canadian135
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Western Antea Palace in July, 2011. Excellent location - very quiet street, easy walk to the main tourist sites. The hotel and rooms are done in an opulent style - lots of gilt, gold plate, mirrors, and our 9 year old daughter loved it. As importantly - you can walk to the ocean front at night and stroll, see the families having evening picnics, play in the exercise park. You can also walk to the Kumbapi train station, see the fish market and fish restaurants frequented by locals and not tourists. Excellent buffet breakfast is included in most packages - eggs, fruit, meat and cheese, yogurt, cereal, breads. The world's smallest pool (open until 6 pm for free; after that, must pay) was good for cooling down after walking around Istanbul. We thought it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a royal”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenSonja
Reviews.Content: We felt like royals from first sekond we arrived. The staff are very professionel and this high quality of service in every way, made us an magnificent holiday. The terasse with the great wiew in the eveningtime, maked us relaxed. To find a hotel with an indoor pool in Istanbul is very hard to find, but here we found it and loved it. The placement of this hotel is perfect. You can walk to all the most important sightseeings in a few minutes. Be sure we will be back again, soon.

Reviews.Title: “walking distance from world heritage sites! great location -- we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Mamed_Askerov
Reviews.Content: me and my wife loved how close to tourist sites the hotel is -- be it aya sofiya mosque or the bazaar - it was exciting to experience the beauty of the city of the byzantine empire and modern turkey. hotel staff was so kind to us and treated us as their won friends, they even provided a great deal once they found we are a newlyweds and that was our first trip as a family couple. we hope to return to this hotel one fine day in future, maybe with our newly-born baby :)

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: msahba
Reviews.Content: This 4-star hotel has got a very impressive spa. We all loved it. The hotel made our stay in Istanbul very relaxing and soothing. The daily cleaning was good, and the beds were very comfortable. The location fitted us perfectly. A walking distance to all the important sight-seeings, such as the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar. The staff was very helpful, and the breakfast was a nice start in the beginning of the day. Thank you so much! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: benjamin1996
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at this hotel for 1 week and we liked it alot! The staff was very friendly and the hotel was pretty clean. The meals were quite excellent! We liked this stay and we might return next year :)

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed this hotel and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: asena5emre2orhan
Reviews.Content: great hotel staff friendly. good food. book hotel for september. can`t wait to go back to enjoy the experience agen.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katyasbt
Reviews.Content: Situated in a historical part,very good service!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sedatcarmina
Reviews.Content: we have been in this hotel for 3 night and we liked alot...the hotel was very clean and staff very nice,breakfast was perfect..we enjoyed alot so we would like to come back again...

Reviews.Title: “Good service and the best roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: JosefineWol
Reviews.Content: First of all Antea Palace is situated extremely well! There is a five minute walk to Aya Sofia and The Blue Mosque and the immediate neighbourhood is the rather worndown but history laden "Old Istanbul" with its wooden houses and small cafes full of local people drinking appletea. The hotel itself stands out from this environment as it is quite new and very well kept. It is decorated in a lavish, "eastern" fashion and contains both a small svimming pool, a hammam (steam bath) and a roof terrace which overlooks The Bosporus and Old Istanbul. The room we stayed in had good airconditioning and a very nice and large bathroom. It could have been a little bit bigger, but then we spent a lot of the time on the terrace and in the pool. The service in the hotel was very good, extremely childfriendly and very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Best service we ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Sabuncu
Reviews.Content: The 24 hours service from the reception was exelent and we get all the help we needed. All receptionist spoke english very good We called the hotel before we came and they arranged shutlleservice from the airport to the hotel. .The rooms were very delicius decorated and very clean. The space of the room and our balcony was exelent. This hotel is in 10 minutes walkingdistance to Sultan Ahmet, Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazar and to the tram station. The pool and spa area was a good place to relax after a long day in a warm metropol. We can only give our best recommend to this hotel. We are sure we will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “a very good choice”
Reviews.Author: PatrickEssonnes
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel; The rooms are comfortable, the service is Impeccable and the staff very helpful. the hotel is just minutes walk from St Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Come to it , See it and Love it!”
Reviews.Author: SapNaida
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Istanbul, where I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights with my boyfriend. I arrived to Brussels half an hour ago and could not wait to write this review (it is 01.10 AM now). Very happy and satisfied. Here is my advise: 1.If you are living a life of "gray frustration" , full of everyday stress-you should leave wherever you are now and come to Istanbul to this particular hotel. 2. If you want to be treated as a valuable individual even if you are a member of a large group-you should not hesitate to give a shot to this hotel. 3. If you appreciate kindness, friendliness and professionalism-this is the place to be. 4.If you respect past and value present-this is the place where you will see the blends. 5. If you want to be treated as a person and not as a "walking cash machine"-you must stay at this hotel, because you will feel loved and appreciated by who you are and not by the amount of money you will spend and days you will stay. Having said so, the hotel staff will assist you with every single acquirement you have. They will arrange best restaurants with best reasonable price (Yildizlar restaurant , for example); they will arrange personal drivers-free of charge (to any of those best- price restaurants and back to hotel). Many more friendly services, that will leave happiness and satisfaction on you. By the time you will leave this hotel, you will missed-I guarantee, you will have nostalgia for the wonderful staff you met at your stay. I am sorry, I do not toke any photos of the hotel because, I believe, my camera would have been minimized the quality of this wonderful hotel and its staff. But, luckily, you can view the hotel photos without my personal captions. All the best, Naida & Doug June 6th, 2011 01.18 AM Brussels

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is very good”
Reviews.Author: TassaSki
Reviews.Content: Wonderful surroundings. And easy to get in contact with people. The staff is the best....kind and helpful. Good breakfast and good beds for sleeping after a walking day in Sultanahmet. I really love this place ! And the harbour is not far away, just 10 minutes walk and you can take a trip on Bosphous, I really recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Have a nice time in the BEST WESTERN Antea Palace Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eva_Soeber
Reviews.Content: Hallo to everybody! ich stayed in the BEST WESTERN Antea Palace Hotel one month ago and frankly speaking i was positive surprised about the favourable location of the hotel, its complaisant service, the comfortable rooms, the modern hotel, the tasty food, the fitnessroom and business center. I have really enjoyed my stay in the hotel and recommend you to choose the BEST WESTERN Antea Palace Hotel if you want to enjoy your time in Istanbul! Best regards, Eva

Reviews.Title: “This place has it all!”
Reviews.Author: beanskky1
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this comfortable, friendly and very convenient hotel on our trip to Istanbul May 2-5, 2011. Ercan Ulu and his entire staff were wonderful, helpful, and always ready to answer our questions and guide us to the best sites and restaurants. Our trip to Turkey was made so much easier and enjoyable because of our stay. The rooms were lovely, clean and service was excellent.. They even had a treadmill and other gym equipment in the downstairs area, and a nice buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chipolina13
Reviews.Content: New comfortable hotel, great location, friendly and high professional staff, clean rooms and good breakfast. It looks much better in reality than on photos. There are only 2 things that may dissatisfy some travellers: standard rooms are not big and those with a back yard view are noisy because of a school nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value and personal service”
Reviews.Author: jamie67
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the hotel, its staff, location, service and value for money. Easy ride from the airport. Traveled with 2 children aged 7 and 11 to Istanbul for the first time and we had a great time. The room was very good, very clean, well serviced and the kids enjoyed the breakfasts too. Not many kids in the hotel, but the staff went out of their way to be very helpful and friendly. Easy to move around the city's famous sights from the hotel location on foot, by tram and taxi. Shopping was good too.

Reviews.Title: “its a very comfortable and nice hotel with a friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: almaazik
Reviews.Content: Hello!!!! I reccomend this hotel for all coz its a very comfortable and nice hotel with a friendly atmosphere, good food, nice rooms. Not far from Blue mosque, Haghia Sophia and Great Bazaar Natalia

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: fbuyssch
Reviews.Content: Hotel is average: room is small but clean. Breafkast is not good: only cereals, some fruit and bread. After 9.30 h. there is no bread anymore. The swimming pool is ok but small. A coca cola is 4 euro! The beds are not very good, My back was sore. In general a good hotel, didn't find another one that was better...

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Naiida
Reviews.Content: There is no need to search for any other hotel for a wonderful stay in Istanbul. The location is excellent with everything in the Old Town area in walking distance. Everything was just perfect and more than that. We stayed for five nights and really enjoyed it; we wish we were able to stay longer! The hotel is fresh and clean and the breakfast is amazing. The hotel restaurant was also excellent. We would definitely stay here again and would unhesitatingly recommend this hotel to others. One of the main reasons we enjoyed the hotel so much was the warm welcome we received from the minute we arrived. The staff at the hotel is excellent and most welcoming!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Hotel in a Magic City”
Reviews.Author: anna_serova
Reviews.Content: Dear Ladies and Gentleme, if you want to spend a beautiful and memorable time in Turkey, especially in Istanbul, you should choose the BEST WESTERN Antea Palace Hotel on the gorunds of wounderful location of the hotel, dainty food, clean rooms, romantic atmosphere, perfect service and good price. I am sure you will enjoy your trip and stay in the BEST WESTERN ANtea Palace Hotel:) I wish you to have a lot of fun and pleasure in Turkey! Best regards, Anna

Reviews.Title: “A good place for a cultural visit”
Reviews.Author: AnitaKiss
Reviews.Content: The room was too expensive, it was too small and the window looked at the next housewall. But the breakfast-buffet was very good. The hotel-airport-shuttle is only included if you stay more than 5 nights, and we payd 50 Euros from Ataturk-Airport to the hotel and back and that was the price like with a taxi. The whole hotel-interieur was very elegant and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ppsantoro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, and staff is so special. I live stayed in there. If you need some information about the city or about a good programmation to do, you can ask and trust to anyone of staff. Always so kind. Thevrestaurant is good ans spa too. Good option

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, service and restaurant, in a difficult place”
Reviews.Author: paredesruiz
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and people, very kind. One of the best restaurants in Istanbul. Room very nice, although there was a fan noise, particular to that room. The place is in Sultanahmet, narrow streets of cobblestones, difficult to drive and to find.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for vacation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Katerina30467
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel in terms of service, rooms and excellent location for sight seeing. You can walk to Blue Mosque, Sophia Hugia, Topkapi Palace or Basilica Cistern in minutes. The room was very quiet and beautiful.Their Spa was good, pool not very big but atmosphore is great. We had breakfast every day, which was OK. We ate twice in the evening, which was (surprisingly) cheaper than many local restaurants and well presented. The hotel staffs were friendly and willing to help. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We made a good choice for our hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margly
Reviews.Content: First visit to Istanbul and after reading many reviews decided on Antea Palace. Recently refurbished to a good standard in an excellent location for sight seeing. Excellent staff who could not do enough to help and please. Drinks a bit pricey but on the whole Istanbul is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing travel”
Reviews.Author: ali293934
Reviews.Content: HI, am now writing from my home with a cup of coffee and with great members from turkey. First of all i would like to say the hotel where i stayed with my friends was amazing, so how is going to visit Istanbul just choose Best Wertern Antea Palace Hotel why? Amazing rooms, comfortable, serving perfect, so nice and so on I felt my self like at home, with my family. Location of this hotel is in the center, so no problem to visit different historical and such places with problem. Only some minutes from Sultan Ahmet Value is too normal, can find out for different prices, so for my 1 week i spent no so much what i thought before. Any way, for the next time, i am going to stay there for a long time, so need my summer vocation respects to every one :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in the center”
Reviews.Author: svk312
Reviews.Content: I visited Best Western in March along with my girlfriend and it was very nice and the hotel was a mixture between modern and historical culture. The hotel is located in the center on the town and the Wlan in the room was very good as i had to do some office work in between my holidays. The food was delicious and resonably priced. The hotel staffs were friendly and willing to help. On the whole we were happy with Best Western and would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wounderful and memorable trip to Istanbuls Best Western Antea Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: istanbul-trip-2011
Reviews.Content: Dear Ladies and Gentlemen, my Name is Sevinch. One month ago me and my friends visited Istanbul and stayed at the Best Western Antea Palace Hotel. I must admit that we enjoyed our stay in this hotel, because it was a very nice and comfortable atmosphere and a beautiful place to stay in. Moreover the service of the hotel was very friendly and helpful. We could see wounderful nature of Istanbul and liked our detention there. I recommend emphatic everybody who wishes to enjoy their stay in Turkey, Istanbul to visit Best Western Antea Palace Hotel! Best regards, Sevinch:)

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and relax trip”
Reviews.Author: Marlen_Ditrich
Reviews.Content: It's really nice. The room was very quiet and beautiful. And we'd a sea-view. We like it.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lazy_Elephant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the end of March. We thought western chain hotel would be a safer bet as we can expect ceratin standards. If we were to go back to Istanbul, we will be booking a Turkish one. Overall, we thought this hotel is overcharging for what they provide - a cheap motel with decandant untasteful decoration in less than ideal location - if you want a good night sleep, don't bother. Below are the specifics (sorry the list is rather long): (1) Location: - At the bottom of a very steep hill in a very residential area (not an upmarket residential area, and rather poor lighting at night) - located between a technical college & local football pitch (the ones locals come to play) - Away from any public transport - it looked on the map when we were looking at reviews, and yes the Blue Mosque & Hagia Sofia is in a walking distance, but the closest tram stop is on the top of a very steep hill (40 degrees?) (2) Room: - Walls are so thin that we could hear the next room occupants putting coins and keys on desks, if they watch TV, you hear every word, I had to ask people in the corridor to stop talking two days in a row as they woke me up from my sleep - Rooms are decorated untastefully - imagine red carpets you see in cheap pubs meets either light green or lavender fake velvet bed cover - Tiny shower - I am 5"2 (156cm) tall, size 8 (UK)/4(US)/38~40(EU) female, and I just about managed to shower. My husband, 5"11 tall, managed but struggled. - no bath - we saw a room with a bath but the size of the bath is just enough to sit (as in sit on a chair) - unless you are a 6month old baby, you won't be able to lie down - smoke rising up from main atrium seeping into the rooms - wardrobe was very small, not enough hangers for those who stay longer than a night or two (3) Sleep: - Thanks to the thin walls, we could not sleep until the next door guests stop watching TV, and as mentioned, I had to ask in my PJ to other guests in the corridor to keep their voices down, and I was woken up 2 days in a row thanks to guests talking in the corridor - located right next to a college who seems to have PE classes from early in the morning meant that we kept hearing all sorts of alarms from speakerphones in addition to men shouting on a costant basis (4) Breakfast - one of the poorest buffet I havecome across at this grade of hotel - coffee was practically over boiled every morning - we were reminded not very politely that we came to breakfast late - they didn't bother giving us any benefit of doubt despite that there was a time change - we didn't realise they change on Monday, not Sunday like rest of Europe or US, so when we saw the sign at arrival, we thought it was already done - and the clocks in the room doesn't change as it's not one of those synchronising ones - breakfast is provided in the lobby floor with no natural light or window of any kind (5) Service / Sales pitch on arrival: - When we arrived, the manager on duty talked us through diffierent hotel organised tour options - we recommend not to take them - they are overcharging you - They try to sell you the tours but don't tell you there is a street just 5mins down the road filled with seafood restaurants with nice atomosphere (6) view from the hotel - Not much of a view of Sea of Marmara or Blue Mosque or any other - if you go to the roof top, you can see the sea, but isn't a great view thanks to the football pitch with high fence in front of the hotel - our room had a view of the college playground (7) Miscellaneous - lift - was not working properly on the day of arrival (and another day later in the week) - our room was on the 2nd floor, but by the time you spend 8hours walking around the city, walking up and down the stairs and hills, last thing you want is dragging your shopping up 2 flights of stairs with aching legs and feet - some of the amernity items were empty - I opened the box of shower cap, which was empty, I opened another box for some Q tips, they were empty - our safety box didn't work very well (or that the instruction provided was not very useful) - the room key - didn't work a few times during the 5 day stay (eg each time we have to go back down to reception to get this sorted) For this, we thought 104 euros a night (416 euros for 4 nights) was rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Its different, oriental but too small and loud”
Reviews.Author: romantix1
Reviews.Content: Plus: Very clean, friendly staff, Oriental look Minus: too small rooms and bath rooms,loud - roadwork on the backside and footballfield at the entry.

Reviews.Title: “4* hotel in 3* neighbourhood; excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: bencampion
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with family in a huge room with an overaweing round bed - wasted on us with the girls staying in the same room! 2 single beds put in the room for the girls worked well and made for excellent value for money. The hotel has recently been brought & refurbed by an Azerbajani group to a staggeringly high & ostentatious standard with the typical finish of an eastern paradise... steel screws in brass fixtures etc. This is a very plush hotel, beautifully decorated, with a spa area in the basement that is fab. A small endless pool, sauna & turkish masage room area that was in operation, although not quite finished, during our stay. We had breakfast every day, which was OK, if unexciting, but a Best Western staple (we have stayed with a much worse Best Western hotel in Athens before). We ate once in the evening, which was (surprisingly) cheaper than many local restaurants and well presented, although not much choice. The staff were very attentive and looked like they had been working 24/7 to ensure the hotels success during its refurbishment. There was always some Azerbajani managers loitering about looking like Russian mafia who didn't speak English, which was a bit odd, but added to the quirky nature of Istanbul. This was a good hotel which is definitely worth considering if the price is right. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: venezuella
Reviews.Content: The service at the reception desk was friendly and helpfull. The rooms are sufficient and clean; we had sight at the sea. The beds were of a good quality. Breakfast was included in buffet, mainly turkish local food. The location of the hotel is in the centre of the old town; most of the sightseeings can be reached by food and public transport is nearby

Reviews.Title: “helpfull friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ausdennis
Reviews.Content: well.we booked at antea palace for three days.it was nice experience for us.room is nice clean.breakfast was delicous.staff very friendly and helpfull.they helped on everything .hotel close to all highlihts of istanbul.you can walk to st.sophia or this blue mosque in 5 minutes.we can recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “100 % pleasure”
Reviews.Author: sommermari
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband had 3 beautyfull days in Istanbul.This Best western Hotel, have the highest service I ever have experienced in Istanbul, wich is our favorit metropol. The rooms were delighted with very big space and the bath with spa was manicficent. The balkony was also very large. The hotel have a good placement were you can walk to all the most important sightseeing. The receptionist Ercan was very helpfull. He helped us in every way no matter what we asked him about. He speak a very good english . To wake up morningtime and just take the lift to the swimmingpool was very nice. I can imagine when summertime come ! I can only say: The best and luxery holiday we ever had.

Reviews.Title: “i love TURKEY”
Reviews.Author: Smileysss
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about the Antea Palace. We were met at the airport and treated like family from the moment we walked in the door. The staff were helpfull, friendly and anxious to make our stay in Istanbul memorable and pleasurable. Everyone spoke English well and were able to answer any questions we had. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was stocked with everything we needed. We made daily use of the tea making service. Breakfast was attractively presented and consisted of a wide variety of freshly prepared foods. The location is great for all of Sultanahmet's attractions. In short, we would not hesitate to stay here again or to recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay of Leisure”
Reviews.Author: Halz5
Reviews.Content: Change of Management has definately blossomed this treasure of a hotel... Clean, comfortable, location is perfect! You are greeted and assisted to with smiles through out your stay :) Great customer service, keep up the GREAT work! We and more friends/family WILL BE BACK :)

Reviews.Title: “posh and classy”
Reviews.Author: bishopgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days and found the hotel very much to our liking.Room comfortable with view of Marmara Sea. Ate in hotel 2 nights in the restuarant - lovely staff and food was very good.loved their satelite system you have tv channels almost in every languages Location is 5 minute uphill walk to Blue Mosque and Hagai Sophia. Situated in a small side street .i can recommend this hotel.you won't regret

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Antea Palace Hotel & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: Kucuk Ayasofya mah.Yusuf Askin Sok.no: 28 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
